item.title: The realization of wavefront control for matter waves by perforated metasurface
item.description: 11/2020-02/2021 Supported by Nanjing Tech University In this project, I focus on extending the concept of metasurface to matter waves (nowadays we have optical metasurface and acoustic metasurface) based on theoretically calculation. Some main results are: I demonstrate that waveguide mode resonances and constructive interferences of surface diffraction modes can lead to 100% transmission of matter waves through subwavelength slits of thick rectangular grating that would be otherwise opaque for these wavelengths.

item.title: Application of high efficiency porous and slotted metasurface to optical polarization and phase control
item.description: 08/2020-09/2020 Supported by the National Natural Science Foundation of China and Nanjin Tech University In this project we need to realize high efficiency polarization and wavefront control of light by porous and slotted metasurface. The prototype of this kind of metasurface has been studied in [1,2]. In this project, I mainly focus on wavefront control and find highly-efficient wavefront bending in optical regime is attainable by a single-layer perforated metasurface (plasmonic metasurface, free-standing).

item.title: The realization of visible color filtering by metasurface
item.description: 09/2020-10/2021 Supported by Nanjing Tech University This is a company project. We need to design some metasurfaces that can realize the filtering of the visible color (these metasurfaces have applications in light-emitting display, e.g., OLED, LCD). All visible colors are the mixture of blue, green and red and what we need to do is to pick out or filter one of them (they have different frequency). In this project, I realize the purpose in three different ways based on simulation .
